Articles.Content:
This thread might actually be more suited to general discussion. The goal is to show off your achievements with Tech=0 parts. It can be something you've already done, something someone else has done (as long as you give them full credit) or it can be something you want to do and are now going to do it. The only thing is that you can not unlock any tech nodes.

Score will be total science points multiplied by the body you visit, and multiplied by 2 for returns to Kerbin, aside from Tylo, Eve, and Laythe, who get x3, x4, and x3.5 respectively. Score does not apply for grand-tours of three planets or more. You get a free awesome-coin for that.

Here's a few suggestions:

Kerbin Orbit=x2

Mun Orbit=x3

Mun Landing=x3

Minmus Landing=x3

Mun and Minmus in one flight=x4.5

Gilly Landing=x4.7

Eve Landing=x5

Duna Landing=x5.5

Moho Flyby=x5.8

Dres Flyby=x5.7

Dres Landing=x6

Eeloo Landing=6.5

Jool System Expedition=x7

Moho Landing=x7.6

Laythe Landing=x7.9

Moho Landing=x8.5

Tylo Landing=x9.4

This thread might actually be more suited to general discussion.

Or the Spacecraft Exchange maybe, est to leave it here for the moment to see how it develops though

Hmm, I may have to see what my go-to tech zero craft is really capable of...
I think it should stay in challenges, after some thought.
OP have you actually achieved any of these other than Kerbin orbit?

I'll definitely have to give this a go.....normally I only do a single sub-orbital mission for my Tech-0 level. But it *should* be possible to go quite a bit further. With only a pod, parachute and 8 SRBs you can do quite a nice trip into space....up-scaling that rig should allow a trip to orbit, which means that Minmus is definitely an option. Electricity will be an issue though.

Decoupling via overheats is clunky, but should suffice for staging.

OP have you actually achieved any of these other than Kerbin orbit?

No, but I've seen others do many of these. Never seen Tylo or Eve or Laythe, which is why I want to see it. But that's not the point. I just want to see what other people can do.

You might want to check out

It's really quite a feat.
